Mike is wonderful, talented, humble and kind, but we also had another bartender who was rude and obnoxious, but that doesn't appear to be the norm. Try it out and have fun in Bernal.
author: R L.

description: Yummy old fashioned and a wonderful wide variety of IPA's on tap - score! Great neighborhood bar and dog friendly. Best part, $1 off drinks during happy hour (til 7pm). I recommend a visit when you're in the hood.
author: Misty A.

description: I came here with my boyfriend on a Tuesday night - decent cocktails, friendly bar staff and reasonable prices. Not super comfortable decor though, so it depends what ambience you're looking for.
author: Orla M.

description: Went in on week night, very chill place, cool, casual, darker atmosphere, great place for a relaxing drink or two and not to mention really friendly bartenders!
author: Thomas C.

description: Best Gimlet ever! Jungle Bird is also very delicious. ;) Love the ambience and Leilani the bartender is cool and super knowledgeable. This will be my regular spot for sure.
author: Jeehyun T.

description: Tasty, consistent and inventive drinks.  Can get a bit LOUD with all the hard surfaces but overall a cool nifty bar to have in the 'hood.  We stopped in recently for pre-dinner drinks and had a blast.
author: Rick G.

description: This tucked away bar doesn't feel like SF..in a good way. The drinks are wonderful, inventive and strong and the space gives you room to breath and relax.
author: Etha D.

description: Three drinks for $20, it was happy hour but pretty good deal for this town!  Two of them custom drinks per bartenders recommendation, and he nailed what we were in the mood for with both.  Chill atmosphere, very nice staff, great selection... wouldn't change a thing.
author: Joe B.

description: If I lived in the neighborhood I would come here all the time, but it's not really worth the trek. Drinks were good but a tad pricy and the crowd was very good looking.
author: Kate M.

description: I love the fact that an amazing bar with even more amazing beers on tap is just a  few blocks from my house in Bernal. The staff is great, always making sure you are hydrated with water and never have had to wait to long for a drink. Music is always a plus for me and this place never disappoints in their selection.
author: Nico B.

description: Excellent bar! I frequent this place during weeknights and it is always a great experience. The bartender is really friendly. And they have great beers to boot! Would definitely recommend.
author: Amy L.

description: one of my favorite bars in the city, hands down. Great cocktails, very cute, mellow.
author: Fred A.

description:
Much needed upscale addition to Bernal.

Bartenders are really friendly.

Comfortable, welcoming vibe.

Cocktails were fantastic & reasonably priced $9ish (Moscow Mule was one of the best I've ever had).

Decor is a bit gray for my taste (think industrial w hint of rustic). Definitely look up & admire the Japanese block print wallpaper on the ceiling. lighting & artwork make for great conversation.

Just opened so if wasn't crowded but I'm sure that will change :-)
author: Amy B.

description: What a nice surprise in Bernal! We don't spend too much time over there but now we have a reason to leave our hood and head over. Great drinks and really nice staff. It's reminiscent of their sister spot Churchill but much more of a local hood feel. The only downside is that it's not in Noe Valley - we need something like this over here!
author: Cynthia L.

description: I made my first pilgrimage to Holy Water during the Fiesta on the Hill celebration on Sunday, Oct 20th.  The spiritual rebirth of Stray is complete.  The sanctuary and sacraments are truly born again.  The bartender (Cora?) was transcendentally charming and attentive (and I am not used to such attention as I am 25-30 years older than the typical patron at these kind of places). Yea, though I walked home through the valley of the shadow of death, the mescal cocktail I had delivered me from evil and restored my soul.  I will come here again and again.
author: John T.

description: definitely my favorite bar in SF. the best drinks, best decor, and overall best environment.
author: Anthony A.

description: I'm a local, and while I miss the old Stray Bar, I really, really like this place. It's low-key, and it doesn't have any of the pomp of other places with a similar repertoire of cocktails on offer. The prices are reasonable, the service friendly, the bathrooms clean, and the space is nice. And it still allows dogs and shows the games when they're on. I think it's a great addition to the neighborhood.
author: ashley h.

description: the atmosphere aint my deal but the bartenders were really cool and their are multiple local beers and spirits which is dope...other than that tho theres not enough for me to want to frequent it...
author: Bane V.

description: went here with a friend Saturday nice.  fun place.  good drinks, service was good too.  I think I may have had one too many, he he
author: Alejandra H.

description: Chill atmosphere, great cocktails, excellent staff, good crowd and a solid beer selection. If nothing on the cocktail menu suits you, then the guys behind the bar are nice enough to mix up an off menu drink. It's so refreshing to find a place where the bartenders are happy to make you a cocktail instead of acting aloof.  Keep up the good work.
author: Jonah N.

description: great atmosphere and good drinks.  it was nice that the bar wasn't super crowded like other parts of the city.
author: Lucas F.

description: Excellent cocktails, friendly bartenders, prices are good.  The ice in the Moscow Mules helps make the drink!  I am a big fan of equal coldness distribution and this is super refreshing.  Good beer selection - would be even more superb if they added a seasonal brew like He Said 21st Amendment for Fall instead of the Watermelon Wheat.  It is noisy with the concrete walls and floor, but all and all, a great addition to the neighborhood!
author: K V.
